channel.title: Comments on: Beware Argent Dawn Bearing Gifts

item.title: By: Bizz
item.dc:creator: Bizz
item.description: heather: true, but then again you often see that irl aswell...
item.content:encoded: heather: true, but then again you often see that irl aswell…

item.title: By: Heather
item.dc:creator: Heather
item.description: Bizz: Heh. The funny thing is, two of the nicest players I know are the 11- and 14-year-old kids of a friend of mine. They were just raised to be exceptionally polite and nice, and they're nicer players than most adults.
item.content:encoded: Bizz: Heh. The funny thing is, two of the nicest players I know are the 11- and 14-year-old kids of a friend of mine. They were just raised to be exceptionally polite and nice, and they’re nicer players than most adults.

item.title: By: Bizz
item.dc:creator: Bizz
item.description:
This was a nice posting:
"These are probably from kids...
I really didn't understand a lot about WoW until I went to visit a 10 year old and a 12 year old who play WoW.
They find it fun to beg. They find it fun to scam people. They find it funny to ninja loot.
I had a long talk with them about morality in life and games.
I learned a lot about why so many people in WoW are so wierd. "
item.content:encoded:
This was a nice posting:

“These are probably from kids…

I really didn’t understand a lot about WoW until I went to visit a 10 year old and a 12 year old who play WoW.

They find it fun to beg.
They find it fun to scam people.
They find it funny to ninja loot.

I had a long talk with them about morality in life and games.

I learned a lot about why so many people in WoW are so wierd. “

item.title: By: Heather
item.dc:creator: Heather
item.description: I just don't get how folks can fall for that scam. I really don't. Someone sends you a "gift", but you have to pay for it and even hit a confirmation button agreeing to the COD. If you have to pay for it, it isn't a gift. So that should be the big, GLARING neon sign that something's wrong even if the spelling and general situation don't tip you off.
item.content:encoded: I just don’t get how folks can fall for that scam. I really don’t. Someone sends you a “gift”, but you have to pay for it and even hit a confirmation button agreeing to the COD. If you have to pay for it, it isn’t a gift. So that should be the big, GLARING neon sign that something’s wrong even if the spelling and general situation don’t tip you off.
